posts.name: Jayakrishnan
posts.cooked:
In light of the issues raised by students in Discourse regarding Project 1, the following remedial measures are being taken:

Regarding Issue of “Submit Button” for the Quantitative Submission

  • We have been made aware that several students submitted test runs for their project submissions and then were notified that their project has not been received. We are able to see any test runs that were submitted. We want to reassure you, if you did your "Test Run", then your last "Test Run" submission will still be considered.
  • If you encountered the above problem or any other portal problems, please send some evidence of the problem you encountered in this discourse thread. This will help the operations team to diagnose why this error occurred. Screenshots, error messages, etc would be helpful. Please keep everything in a single post per student (i.e do not make multiple post submissions)

Please use the poll below to indicate your issue and provide a detailed response as a reply to this post.

  • I was unable to click on “Submit” button, but I was able to click on “Test Run”
  • I was neither able to click on “Submit” nor “Test Run”
  • I had a different issue
0 voters

Regarding submission issues related to Peer Reviews for Project 1

Clarification

Peer Review submission = You submit for review from others + You review submission given by others

And there is a causal link between these two, i.e., you submit for getting review from others and hence you receive and hence you get an opportunity to review others. It should not be treated as mutually independent events

The opportunity being provided now is for those who faced technical issues in either of the parts and due to which they were unable to submit.

  • On Friday, August 9, 2024 6:30 AM, we will open the peer review submissions for Project 1 and this will be open till Saturday, August 10, 2024 6:30 AM. The reviews will have to be subsequently completed by Sunday, August 11, 2024 6:30 AM. This will be your last window to submit your part 2 submission and its peer reviews. If you encounter any problems on the day, please get straight away in touch with us through this discourse thread, so that the operations team can in real time evaluate the problem that you are encountering and get you a resolution.
  • If you are unable to access the review submissions due to insufficient access privileges, give a zero for that review and move on to the next review.
  • Likewise please ensure that your project folder has been given full access permissions to “Anyone with the link”. Otherwise you will get a 0 from other reviewers.
  • If you have concerns about getting bad reviews, please read the Course introduction page, a clear detailed explanation is given with regards to how we handle anomalous reviews. So do not worry about it. Please do not fill up discourse with complaints about peer reviews. We have a mechanism to deal with it fairly. If on the other hand you have received 100% when you should not have… be ready to be evaluated fairly too. It cuts both ways.
  • Also, please note that we will be considering the marks for only those who had submission issues for the part 2 assignments earlier. In case you have already received your reviews, we will not be considering your review score for this assignment. In case you missed out on reviewing others in the earlier submission, reviewing as part of current submission will not fetch you marks.

Edit: Updated the nature of submission to include both Part 2 submission and its peer review and detailed out the cases that will be considered for final mark calculation.

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Please refer to this post.

Official Announcement: Housekeeping Tools in Data Science
1. Project submissions which were in the wrong index order, i.e. you did not follow the rule regarding order of questions: Resolution: We will consider all submissions of questions in any order. If you have answered the question correctly we will award you the marks regardless of the order in which you submitted the questions. 2. Test run submitted, but the CSV was not submitted: Resolution: We will consider your test submission if you were not able to submit the csv normally. You will get an …

Kind regards

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi Palak,

This is exactly how the scoring script does it. aka it takes the test submission if the actual submission is missing. But if there is a proper submission, then the submission is scored. JK is looking into your particular record because it seems to be one of a few edge cases where something might have gone wrong.
